update.description:
This PR adds two new components:

* `JointPositionReset`
* `JointVelocityReset`

These components act directly on the physics engine, resetting the simulation state of the selected joint. As discussed in [PR#246](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/246/add-jointcontroller-system/diff), the usage of this feature should not be encouraged since fiddling with the internal state of the simulator generally is not a good practice. Though, if done responsibly, it is a feature that has diverse use cases.

As an example, it is currently possible to insert a model in a running simulation with a given pose. However, I didn’t find any way to apply also a specific joint configuration. These new components allow to obtain such state.

There’s also downstream code of Gazebo Classic that use this features and might need in the future to reset the joint state.
update.title: JointPositionReset and JointVelocityReset components

These components act directly on the physics engine, resetting the simulation state of the selected joint. As discussed in [PR#246](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/246/add-jointcontroller-system/diff), the usage of this feature should not be encouraged since fiddling with the internal state of the simulator generally is not a good practice. Though, if done responsibly, it is a feature that has diverse use cases.

As an example, it is currently possible to insert a model in a running simulation with a given pose. However, I didn’t find any way to apply also a specific joint configuration. These new components allow to obtain such state.

There’s also downstream code of Gazebo Classic that use this features and might need in the future to reset the joint state.
update.title: JointPositionReset and JointVelocityReset components

content.raw:
Thanks @{557058:5de38267-b118-494c-aa76-4fab35448816} for the log. I updated the PR with the style changes.

For some reason I do not understand, this PR does not get updated with the latest changes of my branch. I’m not very familiar with hg / bitbucket. If I Edit the PR from the button in the top, the new commit shows up. Though, even after saving, the PR still does not change. 

For the future, is there any project-wise clang-format I can use? I didn’t find any. It would save a lot of time for these style edits that, done manually, would not be optimal in most cases.
content.html:
Thanks @Steve Peters for the log. I updated the PR with the style changes.

For some reason I do not understand, this PR does not get updated with the latest changes of my branch. I’m not very familiar with hg / bitbucket. If I Edit the PR from the button in the top, the new commit shows up. Though, even after saving, the PR still does not change.

For the future, is there any project-wise clang-format I can use? I didn’t find any. It would save a lot of time for these style edits that, done manually, would not be optimal in most cases.

content.raw: Did you run the \`code\_check\` target? It seems that the indentation is not inline with the contributing guidelines, see point 8 of [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/406665896aa40bb42f14cf61d48b3d94f2fc5dd8/CONTRIBUTING.md?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/406665896aa40bb42f14cf61d48b3d94f2fc5dd8/CONTRIBUTING.md?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) .
content.html: Did you run the `code_check` target? It seems that the indentation is not inline with the contributing guidelines, see point 8 of #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/406665896aa40bb42f14cf61d48b3d94f2fc5dd8/CONTRIBUTING.md?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default .

update.description:
This PR adds two new components:

* `JointPositionReset`
* `JointVelocityReset`

These components act directly on the physics engine, resetting the simulation state of the selected joint. As discussed in [PR#246](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/246/add-jointcontroller-system/diff), the usage of this feature should not be encouraged since fiddling with the internal state of the simulator generally is not a good practice. Though, if done responsibly, it is a feature that has diverse use cases.

As an example, it is currently possible to insert a model in a running simulation with a given pose. However, I didn’t find any way to apply also a specific joint configuration. These new components allow to obtain such state.

There’s also downstream code of Gazebo Classic that use this features and might need in the future to reset the joint state.
update.title: JointPositionReset and JointVelocityReset components

There’s also downstream code of Gazebo Classic that use this features and might need  in the future to reset the joint state.
